content.body: jarhar: https://bugs.webkit.org/show_bug.cgi?id=228843#c5 makes me wonder how for auto-expanding `details` y’all dealt with AT/screen-reader handling. Did you yourself implement something for it? Or else somebody else did in in a separate patch? Or else for Chromium it was already working and you didn’t have to add anything new?

m.new_content.formatted_body: \<!DOCTYPE html>\<html lang="en"> \<head> \<meta charset="UTF-8"> \<meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0"> \<title>Document\</title> \<style> .note::before { background: green; content: "Note"; -webkit-user-select: text; -moz-user-select: text; -ms-user-select: text; user-select: text; } \</style> \</head> \<body> \<p class="note" role="note"> ::before "Text" \</p> \</body> \</html>

I am unable to select the css generated content "Note" by the pseudo class ::before

<!DOCTYPE html>
<html lang="en">
<head>
    <meta charset="UTF-8">
    <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0">
    <title>Document\</title>
    <style>
        .note::before {
           background: green;
           content: "Note";
           -webkit-user-select: text;
           -moz-user-select: text;
           -ms-user-select: text;
            user-select: text;
             }
         </style>
   </head>
<body>
    <p class="note" role="note">
           ::before
           "Text" </p> 
</body>
</html>
